security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown files with git workflow guidance. No executable code, no network calls, no filesystem access beyond reading documentation. The skill provides educational content about git operations using external tools.

content.user_title: Master git operations with visual tools
content.value_statement: Git workflows can be complex and hard to remember. This skill provides quick reference guides for lazygit, GitHub CLI, and delta to streamline staging, commits, PRs, rebasing, and more.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through interactive git staging with lazygit TUI
Create and manage pull requests using GitHub CLI (gh)
View diffs with syntax highlighting via delta
Provide quick reference for git rebase operations
Explain git stash patterns and workflows
Guide bisect, cherry-pick, and worktree operations
limitations: Requires local installation of git, gh, lazygit, and delta
GitHub operations need network access and authentication
Skill provides guidance, not automated execution
Does not handle GitHub Actions or complex CI workflows

use_cases.title: Create and merge pull requests

use_cases.title: Review code with visual diffs

use_cases.title: Clean up commit history
use_cases.description: Squash, reorder, and edit commits interactively before merging

best_practices: Make frequent, small commits with clear messages
Rebase onto main before merging to keep history clean
Use descriptive stash messages to find work later
anti_patterns: Don't apply stashes without reviewing their contents first
Never rebase branches that others are working on
Don't skip writing commit messages during interactive rebase

faq.question: What tools does this skill require?
faq.answer: Install git, gh (GitHub CLI), lazygit, and delta locally. The skill guides usage but does not install these tools.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: The skill provides guidance and reference materials. It does not execute git commands or automate workflows directly.

faq.question: How does this integrate with my workflow?
faq.answer: Trigger the skill when you need git help. It provides commands and patterns you run in your terminal.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a documentation-only skill. It reads no files, sends no data, and runs no code on your system.

faq.question: Commands are not working as expected
faq.answer: Ensure tools are installed and you have GitHub authentication (run gh auth login). Check you are in a git repository.

faq.question: How does this compare to other git skills?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on visual tools (lazygit, delta) and GitHub CLI integration for efficient terminal-based workflows.
